STATcubeR for non R Users

Source: vignettes/sc_export.Rmd
sc_export.Rmd

This article is aimed at users who are not experienced in R and want to make responses from the STATcube REST API available for other languages.

the easiest way to do this is by using an R script which sends the data to the API and then writes the API response to disk.

# file: get_statcube_table.R
library(STATcubeR)

commandArgs(trailingOnly = TRUE)[1] %>% 
  sc_table() %>% 
  sc_export("response", "csv")

This script accespts one prameter which contains a path to a json api request and will write the API response as well as a csv version of the returned data to disk.

Suppose you want to send the followig API request (from sc_example("accomodation.json"))

{
  "database" : "str:database:detouextregsai",
  "measures" : [
    "str:measure:detouextregsai:F-DATA1:F-UEB",
    "str:measure:detouextregsai:F-DATA1:F-ANK"
  ],
 "dimensions" : [
   [ "str:valueset:detouextregsai:F-DATA1:C-SDB_TIT-0:C-SDB_TIT-0" ],
   [ "str:valueset:detouextregsai:F-DATA1:C-C93-2:C-C93SUM-0" ],
   [ "str:valueset:detouextregsai:F-DATA:C-BBTR_REG-0:C-BBTR_REG2-0" ]
 ]
}

Save this file as accomodation.json in the same folder as get_statcube_table.R. The request can now be sent from the command line using Rscript. Please make sure that your API key is available via .Renviron as described in the API key article

Rscript get_statcube_table.R accomodation.json
#> files created: accomodation/data.csv accomodation/response.json
